trans-unit.source: libpulseaudio - different libpulse bindings module, more low-level, auto-generated from pulseaudio header files.

trans-unit.source: All tests can run for up to 10 seconds currently (v19.9.6), due to some involving playback (using paplay from /dev/urandom) being time-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: 現在 (v19.9.6)では、すべてのテストは最大 10 秒間実行できますが、再生 (/dev/urandom からの paplay を使用)に時間的な制約があるため、いくつかのテストは実行できません。

trans-unit.source: Any test failures can indicate incompatibilities, bugs in the module code, issues with pulseaudio (or its daemon.conf) and underlying dependencies. There are no “expected” test case failures.
trans-unit.target: Any test failures can indicate incompatibilities, bugs in the module code, issues with pulseaudio (or its daemon.conf) and underlying dependencies. There are no “expected” test case failures.

trans-unit.source: Current code logic is that all methods are invoked through the Pulse instance, and everything returned from these are “Pulse-Something-Info” objects - thin wrappers around C structs that describe the thing, without any methods attached.

trans-unit.source: In PulseAudio, “volume” for anything is not a flat number, but essentially a list of numbers, one per channel (as in “left”, “right”, “front”, “rear”, etc), which should correspond to channel map of the object it relates/is-applied to.
trans-unit.target: In PulseAudio, “volume” for anything is not a flat number, but essentially a list of numbers, one per channel (as in “left”, “right”, “front”, “rear”, etc), which should correspond to channel map of the object it relates/is-applied to.

trans-unit.source: In most common cases, doing something like
trans-unit.target: のようなことをするのが一般的です。

trans-unit.source: In place of C integers that correspond to some enum or constant (e.g. -1 for PA_SINK_INVALID_STATE), module returns EnumValue objects, which are comparable to strings (“str” type in py2/py3).
trans-unit.target: In place of C integers that correspond to some enum or constant (e.g. -1 for PA_SINK_INVALID_STATE), module returns EnumValue objects, which are comparable to strings (“str” type in py2/py3).

trans-unit.source: In this module, such lists are represented by PulseVolumeInfo objects.
trans-unit.target: このモジュールでは、このようなリストはPulseVolumeInfoオブジェクトで表現されます。

trans-unit.source: It might be preferrable to use enums instead of strings in the code so that interpreter can signal error on any typos or unknown values specified, as opposed to always silently failing checks with bogus strings.
trans-unit.target: コード中で文字列の代わりに列挙型を使用することが望ましいかもしれません。これにより、インタープリタが誤字脱字や未知の値が指定された場合にエラーを知らせることができます。

trans-unit.source: It might be wise to avoid mixing these with encoded strings (“bytes”) in the code, especially in python-2, where “bytes” is often used as a default string type.
trans-unit.target: It might be wise to avoid mixing these with encoded strings (“bytes”) in the code, especially in python-2, where “bytes” is often used as a default string type.

trans-unit.source: Python (3.x and 2.x) high-level interface and ctypes-based bindings for PulseAudio (libpulse), mostly focused on mixer-like controls and introspection-related operations (as opposed to e.g. submitting sound samples to play, player-like client).
trans-unit.target: Python (3.x and 2.x) high-level interface and ctypes-based bindings for PulseAudio (libpulse), mostly focused on mixer-like controls and introspection-related operations (as opposed to e.g. submitting sound samples to play, player-like client).

trans-unit.source: Test code is packaged/installed with the module and can be useful to run when changing module code, or to check if current python, module and pulseudio versions all work fine together.
trans-unit.target: テストコードはモジュールと一緒にパッケージ化/インストールされており、モジュールのコードを変更する際に実行したり、現在のpython、モジュール、pulseudioのバージョンがすべて一緒に正常に動作するかどうかをチェックするのに便利です。

trans-unit.source: Test suite runs ad-hoc isolated pulseaudio instance with null-sinks (not touching hardware), custom (non-default) startup script and environment, and interacts only with that instance, terminating it afterwards. Still uses system/user daemon.conf files though, so these can affect the tests.
trans-unit.target: テストスイートは、null-sink (ハードウェアには触れない)、カスタム (デフォルトではない)起動スクリプトと環境で、そのインスタンスとのみ対話し、その後終了します。しかし、まだ system/user daemon.conf ファイルを使用しているため、これらのファイルがテストに影響を与える可能性があります。
